intro: Astragalus astragalinus, commonly known as the narrowleaf milkvetch, is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is native to regions of North America. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Astragalus astragalinus is also valued for its role in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in arid environments.
